subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Why the Golden Age Ended
description: A micro-lesson that makes Why the Golden Age Ended usable.

hook.text: The Mongols burned Baghdad in 1258. The Tigris ran black with ink from destroyed books. The Golden Age drowned.

buildup.text: Genghis Khan's grandson Hulagu sacked Baghdad. Libraries, hospitals, and universities were destroyed in weeks.

discovery.text: But the decline had started earlier. Conservative scholars argued that philosophy contradicted faith. Inquiry slowed.

twist.text: Some historians blame al-Ghazali, who argued reason should serve faith, not challenge it. Orthodoxy tightened.

climax.text: The Golden Age died from invasion and internal retreat. Islam's greatest lesson: curiosity must be protected.

punchline.text: Baghdad burned, books drowned. Curiosity's death ended the Golden Age.

quiz.question: What ended the Islamic Golden Age?
options: The Mongol destruction of Baghdad and growing intellectual conservatism
